p:
Putra et al. used mathematical epidemiology to predict the number of pregnant women infected with COVID‐19 in the United States.
52 Their projections suggest the likelihood of 860 475 infections, including in 16 601 pregnant women, in the U.S. Between March and December of this year, among pregnant women infected with SARS‐CoV‐2, 3308 might develop serious disease, 681 cases may develop critical disease, and 52 patients might die.
